item.title: Front Mission 3: Remake Release Date Set for June
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/front-mission-3-remake-release-date

Forever Entertainment has revealed that mech RPG Front Mission 3: Remake is launching next month, completing the set of remakes for the original PlayStation-era trilogy.

Following on from 2022's remake-of-a-remake Front Mission 1st and the following year's Front Mission 2: Remake, the latest entry in the series will be arriving on June 26th, per a brand new trailer.

Curiously enough, no Nintendo Switch 2 Edition version of the game has been announced, so it sounds like it won't be getting any Switch 2 enhancements at launch, at the very least. It's entirely possible that's coming in the future, however.

There's also no word yet on whether Front Mission 3: Remake will be coming to other platforms, although given that both of its predecessors were eventually released outside of the Switch ecosystem, it's a distinct possibility.

The original Front Mission 3 was the first game in the series to make it outside of Japan, as well as the franchise's final numbered release on the original PlayStation (if we don't count remake Front Mission 1st, which also wasn't released in the West in its PS1 form).

Front Mission 3's plot revolves around pilots Kazuki Takemura and Ryogo Kusama, who are caught up in one of the Front Mission series' signature political conflicts. As tensions rise and military zones become more "volatile", Kazuki and Ryogo must pilot their "wanzer" mechs to survive.

Just as with previous Front Mission remakes, you can expect this one to come complete with a number of improvements, including sharper visuals, smoother performance, and gameplay tweaks.

We'll have to wait and see whether Forever Entertainment intends to continue remaking Front Mission games; if so, the next logical candidate in the string would be 2003's Front Mission 4, the first series entry on the PlayStation 2.

In any case, Front Mission 3: Remake launches for Nintendo Switch on June 26th. It will likely also be playable on Switch 2 thanks to backwards compatibility.

item.title: Exclusive MTG Final Fantasy Spoilers (Card Reveals)
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/features/exclusive-mtg-final-fantasy-spoilers-card-reveals

We're so excited for the upcoming Magic: The Gathering Universes Beyond Final Fantasy set, and we're thrilled to have the official spoilers for two brand new cards - straight from our friends at Wizards of the Coast! Let's jump right in.

MTG Final Fantasy - Magic Pot

That's right! We're so lucky to share the exclusive premiere of everyone's favorite recurring enemy: Magic Pot! This 3 mana 1/4 isn't just a decent blocker - it's also a great way to deal with cards causing trouble in your opponents' yards! And the fact that it dies and leaves behind a treasure token is a nice little bonus.

Now let's move onto the big guy, the crystal hunter himself:

MTG Final Fantasy - Golbez, Crystal Collector

We're so excited to premiere exclusive to TechRaptor Final Fantasy IV's number 2 baddie, Golbez! Known as the mysterious Man in Black in the original FFIV game, he later becomes a playable character in FFIV: The After Years. Zealous in his pursuit of Crystals!

That's matched perfectly with the flavor of this card, as Golbez, Crystal Collector cares about being surrounded by Artifacts! I've got plans already brewing to put together a Commander deck around Golbez, Crystal Collector, filling up my board with treasure and food token generation via cards like Nuka-Cola Vending Machine, Academy Manufactor, Currency Converter, and more! Add in discard outlets like big creatures with Cycling (which you can grab back), Golbez, Crystal Collector's own Surveil ability, and old classics like Bottomless Pit, and we've got a nasty little engine here!

Want more MTG Final Fantasy coverage? Check out some of our favorite cards that got spoiled a few weeks back, and hey, while you're here, might as well check out all of our coverage of Final Fantasy over the years and Magic: The Gathering!

What are your thoughts on these two exciting new cards? How hype are you for the new MTG Final Fantasy Universes Beyond set? Let us know in the comments!
